pageTitle: Tony Blair To Speak At Loyola University « CBS Baltimore
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {7293=Blair was prime minister from 1997 to 2007. He ousted the Conservative Party from power seven years after the resignation of Margaret Thatcher, who died on Monday. University officials noted Blair’s investment and reform of schools and hospitals and his international bridge-building experience, which embodies the Jesuit university’s obligation to serve others on an international scale., 6825=(Copyright 2013 by The Associated Press.
